column4: how can I install a package that has unmet dependencies? Make apt-get install it anyway?
always on the edge I see
lmao! hey there! U know it!
try and meet those dependencies would be my suggestion WorkingOnWise , is it a popular package or to bleeding edge?

bleeding edge. Gnome-do the package it wants is actually there, but in hadry it is called something differant. I dont want to change the code if I can just give apt-get the command "apt-get install --because-I-am-smarter-than-you gnome-do"  :)
so is there a way to install a package without meeting the dependencies?
I don't recall the exact option, WorkingOnWise , --force or something
I checked man apt-get and the only thing I found was --ignore-missing, which oddly enough, didnt work....
what are you trying to install exactly?
the dependency problem is a known bug.
do you have it as a deb pkg?
it is a repository. apt-get wont download it because of the dep problem.
you *could* go to that repository via browser, nab pkg then force install via shotgun with gdebi
I don't know the answer so reask the question for others who may know WorkingOnWise , or download the file from the repository address via browser and force install with gdebi
i didnt know gdebi could force an install....
